body:
Hey guys, I thought I'd spark up a discussion.

So today's topic will be the sprint key. If you don't know, this was added in Minecraft 1.7 and allows you to re-initiate your sprint if you hold the sprint key down.
It may not sound like much, but this has practically changed the face of Minecraft PvP. Before, it was difficult to initiate combos and whatnot because of the double-tapping (which was a bit buggy at times and caused trouble,) but with the sprint key, it is so much easier to perform advanced techniques.

What are your thoughts on the sprint key? Do you use it? Are you with or against it?

Personally I am a big fan of the sprint key, as it has made my PvP experience (and Minecraft experience in general) better. It also lets me parkour with much less hassle (parkour with double tap... *shudder*) However, I understand how people would disagree because the skill gap is much smaller now.
body_tagged:

Personally I am a big fan of the sprint key, as it has made my PvP experience (and Minecraft experience in general) better. It also lets me parkour with much less hassle (parkour with double tap... *shudder*) However, I understand how people would disagree because the skill gap is much smaller now.
title: Discussion - Sprint Key

replies.body: AKA BSM.  but I use the sprint key.  for me it is the "F" key
replies.body_tagged: AKA BSM.  but I use the sprint key.  for me it is the "F" key

replies.body:
I thought Better Sprint Mod allowed you to keep it on without pressing a key. Don't quote me on that, though, since I've never used it xD

I keep my sprint key at "shift," and my sneak key is F :P

replies.body:
I agree with it. It makes everything so much more convenient and reduces hassle. I hate that glitchy doubletap sprint. Pretty much every single combo relies on that now. If you got hit once the combo was over. Now I feel like you can demonstrate your skill with great combos, and if you get hit once, most of the time it doesn't disrupt the combo. Unless you do what I do and walk straight into their combo and counter-combo them hard when you hit them a certain way... 

Edit: Sprint is Control
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
My sprint key is ALT and shift is c.
Tip: I just a couple of days ago found out that holding down the sprint key and tapping w as fast as you can, along with a circle strafe will lead to some SERIOUS combos.
I mean i seem to get a lot less knockback with it and people find it harder to hit me when i get in a bad spot using this.

Tbh, Mojang made a mistake adding this. First off, In survival, you can Double tap W no problem, and when it comes to PVP then that counts for "Skill"... You dont simply just double tap and kill your opponent...

But my Sprint key is on Button 4 on my mouse ;)

replies.body:
False, there is an option in BSM that allows you to constantly sprint (essentially auto-sprint).

Going to add, that when you use BSM and pull off a combo, you don't stop sprinting. This causes insane reach which is totally unfair on the user who is playing vanilla PvP.
replies.body_tagged:
False, there is an option in BSM that allows you to constantly sprint (essentially auto-sprint).

Going to add, that when you use BSM and pull off a combo, you don't stop sprinting. This causes insane reach which is totally unfair on the user who is playing vanilla PvP.

reply_to.body_tagged: Like Crusty said, the Sprint Key has faster reaction time than BSM.

replies.body: I'm not talking about AutoSprint, I'm talking about using single tap/pressing/holding a key down to sprint or 8 block, which I mean "response time" as to how fast pushing the keybinded button/key reacts. You're talking about a different part in BSM.
replies.body_tagged: I'm not talking about AutoSprint, I'm talking about using single tap/pressing/holding a key down to sprint or 8 block, which I mean "response time" as to how fast pushing the keybinded button/key reacts. You're talking about a different part in BSM.
